data.fullContent: A letter of intent (LOI) is a written document that sets out the basic details of a proposed transaction between two or more parties. The parties may be individuals, businesses, or organizations. An LOI can be a stand-alone document or the first part of a consulting agreement, a contract, or another agreement. The letter can be used in the sales phase of the sale-and-purchase agreement, or in negotiations when an agreement is not yet in place. In such cases, the letter is used to outline what parties hope to accomplish and to begin the process of discussion and negotiation.

q1.translation: 意向书(LOI)是一份书面文件，列出了双方或多方之间拟议交易的基本细节。当事人可以是个人、企业或组织。

q2.translation: 意向书(LOI)是一份书面文件，列出了双方或多方之间拟议交易的基本细节。当事人可以是个人、企业或组织。意向书可以是独立的文件，也可以是咨询协议、合同或其他协议的第一部分。该信函可用于买卖协议的销售阶段，或在谈判时，协议尚未到位。在这种情况下，信函被用来概述双方希望达成的目标，并开始讨论和谈判的过程。

options.sentence: A letter of intent is not legally binding and does not commit either party to the terms of the agreement through more formal agreements.
